input_text:
Job Title: Senior Software Engineer .NET Full Stack

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Position Purpose: Senior Software Engineer with deep hands-on experience in .NET Full Stack development and experience in providing production support for .NET web applications. The .NET Developer will be responsible for maintaining and troubleshooting production applications, resolving technical issues, and ensuring the stability and performance of our systems. 
Job Objective:Responsible for design, develop, deploy and support of .NET based scalable web applications.Responsible for collaboration with cross-functional team to understand the business requirements and translate it to solutions ensuring that design is in line with the business requirements.Be involved in analysis and design phases of a project, participate in application design sessions, and make solution recommendations.Collaborate with offshore developers, and QA to implement fixes and enhancements to production applications. Support developers by providing technical clarifications, code design, and code reviews.Provide production support for .NET web applications, including troubleshooting and issue resolution.Monitor application performance and implement performance tuning strategies.Develop and maintain technical documentation for production systems.Identify and implement process improvements to enhance the efficiency of production support activities.Execute patches and proactive remediation/replace/updates for existing Applications and Azure cloud resources they rely on. Experience in Azure cloud capabilities including monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimizing/improving availability and performance of applications.Work cooperatively in a team environment. Remain flexible on changing workloads.   Experience/Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related fieldMinimum 8+ years of strong knowledge and expertise in .NET, .NET Core, and Azure Experience in .NET application development technologies, such as C#, ASP.net MVC, Web Forms, Web API, WCF, ADO.net, Entity Framework, SQL ServerProficient in database development, and query optimization T-SQL, Azure SQL Experience in Front End technologies HTML, CSS, Java Script, jQuery, Bootstrap.Knowledge or experience in SignalR Proficient in Azure DevOps (ADO) practices Boards, Git Repos, CI/CD pipelinesStrong knowledge and understanding of object-oriented programming and SOLID principles, design patterns, best practices, dependency injection, containers, and Responsive DesignStrong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Demonstrated analytical, problem-solving, organizational, and interpersonal communication skills.
Preferred Qualifications:Microsoft .NET Azure certifications, such as AZ-900, AZ-204Knowledge of Automobile, Online Auctions, Classifieds industry Culture Barrett-Jackson’s culture is live and in-person our business to the core. Team members are in the office 5 days per week, 8am to 5pm at the Scottsdale, AZ headquarters. During live events the company largely travels together to produce and ensure each event is a success. This requires weekend work and long hours. Most will tell you they’d prefer to be nowhere else. There is unparalleled excitement and energy to each and every event.  For more information on Barrett-Jackson, please visit our website at https://www.barrett-jackson.com/ and follow us on social media via Instagram and Twitter @barrett_jackson, and LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/company/barrett-jackson-auction-company/.  To apply for this role, please submit a resume via LinkedIn along with a letter telling us your story, connection to Barrett-Jackson, and why this job is the job for you.

Experience Level (if available): None
